etymology.description: 充值 + 卡 = card used to add value to an account.
etymology.interpretation: 充值 means adding funds or credit to an account, while 卡 refers to a physical or virtual card. Together it names a card or code used to top up balances like mobile phone credit or digital wallets.

parts.english: recharge; top up; add value; credit (an account)
card; bank/ID card; checkpoint; to get stuck

examples.chinese: 我买了一张充值卡(我買了一張充值卡)，用来给手机话费充值(用來給手機話費充值)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎi le yì zhāng chōngzhíkǎ, yònglái gěi shǒujī huàfèi chōngzhí.
examples.english: I bought a recharge card to top up my mobile phone balance.

examples.chinese: 这张充值卡已经被使用过了(這張充值卡已經被使用過了)，你需要再买一张新的(你需要再買一張新的)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhāng chōngzhíkǎ yǐjīng bèi shǐyòng guò le, nǐ xūyào zài mǎi yì zhāng xīn de.
examples.english: This recharge card has already been used; you need to buy a new one.

examples.chinese: 你可以在便利店购买充值卡(你可以在便利店購買充值卡)，或者用APP直接充值(或者用APP直接充值)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ kěyǐ zài biànlìdiàn gòumǎi chōngzhíkǎ, huòzhě yòng APP zhíjiē chōngzhí.
examples.english: You can buy a recharge card at a convenience store, or recharge directly with an app.
